creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton in honor of John E. Andrus III's 100th birthday
description: image at top of sheet of mouse inside bottom of Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec's monogram; crouching black cat with front PR paw extended, stalking mouse; "18 Rue Clapezron" (?) in cursive below image
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

URC, in pencil: [LD.201]; on back, in pencil: [160], [D201 (?)], [201], [3161] and [Menu pour un diner chez May Belfort]
markings: on back, stamped in brown: [(draped figure, standing)]
medium: Lithograph in dark olive green ink
provenance: Otto Gerstenberg, Berlin (L. 2785). (Robert Light, Santa Barbara, CA), 1958; sold to Kathleen Lord Wick (born 1922, Lake Forest, IL ; died in Boston, MA, 1997) and Peter Arms Wick (1920-2004), Boston, MA. (Eric G. Carlson, New York), 2009.
title: Menu pour un Dîner chez May Belfort
